participating-org.narrative:
The Netherlands Scientific Association for Phytotherapy (NVF-bureau) was founded in 1988, with the objective to improve the qualityand scientific foundations of the use of medicinal plants and other natural products: phytotherapy and phytotherapeutic medicine. In 2003 NVF founded and coordinated the Studiegroep Dier en Kruid (animal-herb studygroup) - a networking group of around over 100 individuals, companies and organisations. Other activities include project management, conference organisation and publishing a scientific journal on medicinal plant and natural product uses (www.fyto.nl).
The Institute for Ethnobotany and Zoöfarmacognosy (IEZ) is a private knowledge center on the use of medicinal plants founded in 1996. IEZ studied in 1996-2000 the use of medicinal plants by animals in primate zoos; later the research subject was widened to the grazing of horses and cattle on medicinal plants; ethnoveterinary research and (historical) ethnobotany within the Netherlands (Europe). Since 1999 IEZ operates NVF bureau. www.ethnobotany.nl
The NVF is in the Netherlands a member association of the Federation of Medical Scientific Associations (www.federa.org) and in Europe one of the founding members of The European Scientific Association for Phytotherapy (www.escop.com).
Activities NVF-bureau: - 1999-present: ESCOP meetings (European Scientific Cooperative on Phytotherapy). NVF is the Dutch (founding) ESCOP member. - 2001-present: member of the ROW-DGL of Dutch ministry VWS, an advisory organ for the Dutch government on health food (Deskundigenoverleg Gezondheidsbevorderende Levensmiddelen)
- 2003-present: founding and coordinating Studiegroep Dier en Kruid (animal-herb studygroup) - a networking group of around over 100 individuals, companies and organisations, working with medicinal plants and animals, with quarterly meetings. - Publish Nederlands Tijdschrift voor Fytotherapie (Dutch Magazine for Herbal Medicine) - 2004- present: Organising post academic courses on pharmacology and pharmacognosy for herbalists (Utrecht University). Activities IEZ: - 1996-present Educational activities on several professional universities (eg SaxionNext cam-opleiding) and student-related research projects (see www.ethnobotany.nl/iezpublications1.htm) - 2001-present: Contributions to several ethnobotanical conferences; see www.ethnobotany.nl/iezpublications1.htm

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
